text: hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here internet's busiest
music nerd and it's time for you review
the new portal LP portal is an
australian death metal act they've been
at it since the 90s and have a handful
of albums under their belt to show for
it over the years the group has had
about a dozen different members many of
them contributing and being members of
other australian extreme music acts as
well however along with groups like
disembowelment as well as nei oblivious
chorus destroyer 666 and bella core
portal has kind of seen a rise to
international metal fame they're really
one of the bigger underground australian
metal acts at the moment but still it's
not like they're a major player in death
metal in general and i would say mostly
that is because of how dam impenetrable
the band's music is they make easily
some of the most chaotic and and dense
death metal I've heard in a while
though the group at times is labeled as
being technical death metal I wouldn't
say the playing that they showcase in
their songs is overly flashy or anything
like that
for the most part what's going to stick
out to you about portal is just how
muddy thick and just blood caked their
sound is which has been a pretty
consistent quality of theirs over the
years albums like 2009 swarf is is not
too far off from the original blueprint
of death metal the guitars are really
grimy the drums are extremely heavy the
death grouser in there as well the
chromatic chord changes are in there too
it's just that portal likes to I guess
sort of cover their songs in a
noticeably larger amount of filth
rendering a lot of the details that they
usually put into their tracks a little I
guess inaudible because these guys do
like to write a lot of different
passages into a single track that could
be around three to five minutes making
it difficult to get a bird's-eye view of
a song quickly or in a handful of
listens the band likes to kind of
bombard the listener not only sonically
with all these just heavy distorted
sounds but I guess sort of musically
with just all of these different ideas
making albums like swarf kind of
disorienting at times but I just get
this like stillness from the band's
music that I would normally get from
like an ambient music piece or a noise
music piece they're not really
interested in in rocking out when I
listen to a portal track especially on
this new LP I kind of feel like I'm
being shoved into an Iron Maiden and the
last thing I want to do is move they
don't really hit grooves they don't have
tension releasing cathartic riffs or
anything like that they're actually much
more interested in experimenting like
the finishing track on hero Blonde which
really kind of closes up shop with
several minutes of just these tremolo
guitars dueling with nothing else in the
mix other than maybe a little bit of
bass to kind of back them up and the
introduction of the same song too has
these sort of weird metallic whales
going way way way sounds like some kind
of weird
chilling sound effect from a horror
movie they don't really care as much
about composing songs as they do just
working with sounds noises and textures
because a lot of the sounds on here
between the guitars and just the heavy
muddy muddy drums they're really brutal
they're dismal they're depressing but
when it comes to the opening guitar
chords on this track oh blonde that I've
been talking about and these tremolo
melodies toward the end pretty much
everything that the band has written is
is a really standard death metal affair
I mean disappointingly standard very
average I actually think this album
doesn't live up to the compositional
standards of most genres much less death
metal like I said the band tends to
assemble all of these quick parts that
they quickly switch out for other parts
in a single track but I mean honestly
it's not like any of these single parts
in my opinion are worth really dragging
out as long as the band actually does
that's actually kind of a saving grace
on this LP what makes some of the songs
on here engaging not
many tracks hit me as being that great
compositionally except maybe the track
or bow morphia where there was actually
a Gothic quality to the guitar leads and
especially the set of intervals that
kind of hit in this long drawn-out chord
that's very sweet kind of romantic in a
sense tracks I liked throughout and I
mean like not necessarily loved liked
throughout our songs like the back wards
in our or Jori Jori on the sounds are
definitely there the production is
definitely there like I said not too far
off from a standard death metal fair but
much noisier much just more hectic the
band puts a lot of intensity and puts a
lot of energy into their performance I
mean they're really kind of playing
their hearts out until they're just like
bursting in their chests and the blood
is spurting out everywhere I like the
guitar freak-outs on the backwards I
like the fact that these syncopated
snare rolls come in and lock in with the
guitars kind of reminds me of something
liturgy would do because when you're
actually able to breach through the
noise and breach through the ugliness
the details it kind of appears that they
didn't put as much effort into that much
more effort kind of went into this outer
shell that makes it difficult to get
into that boney skeletal center there's
not much release to a lot of these songs
there are a lot of parts but there's not
much in terms of structure it's just
tension tension tension tension it's a
lot of noise but still I kind of end up
waiting for something to happen I guess
though I do like portal sounds vex void
I just found to be kind of a unrewarding
listen to an extent I mean it's really
kind of like dragging your injured army
buddy through ten miles of swamp just to
have them die as soon as you get to
shore honestly I guess I'm feeling a
strong forward of a light five on this
LP if you've given it a listen what did
you think of it did you love it did you
hate it
why and what do you think I should
review next
Anthony Fantana portal forever
[Music]
[Music]
